name: Novotel Citygate Hong Kong

reviews.title: They forgot our wake up call
reviews.text: This was our first stop on a two month around the world trip. This is a beautifully new and stylish hotel. The lobby is stunning and I would stay here again. We did encounter some problems however.

We came in from Australia and our family of four had to be up early to catch our flight the next day onto europe and we chose this hotel after the not so positive reviews about the regal airport hotel. Unfortunatly our wake up call never came and we slept through. We had even booked with their shuttle service to take us to the airport and when we didnt show, it still didnt occur to the front desk staff to give our room a call.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sufice to say we would have missed our plane but due to bad weather we ended up having a 10 hour delay anyway. Funnily enough Qantas put us up at the Regal and I was most impressed. Dont be put off by all the other reviews we were very pleased with it. I must admit we did not check in at a busy time though.
reviews.title: This is a great place to stay.

reviews.text: Being toted as almost an 'airport hotel' because of its location it is imperitive that things like, wake up calls, are reliable.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: One note to family travellers, at the time novotel had a policy that children under 12 could stay in a room free with parents. This particular hotel didnt want to do this as it was quite restrictive with the extra beds in the room. We did however push the point and they did allow us to have all four in one room for the same price. This was fantastic as we didnt need to pay for two rooms. Being that it was such a short stopover all being in one room wasnt a problem.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!

likes.disliked: — It's an airport stopover hotel, so it's not downtown

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for one night in September and was thoroughly impressed by the whole operation. Don't get me wrong the hotel is next to the airport so not ideal for a vacation but if its a stop over or a business trip you've found the right hotel. I say this not because its a 5 star luxury experience but its practical, clean, modern, functional and has everything you need in a well planned out no nonsense style that will suit the modern traveller who just wants to get on with it. The courtesy bus service is ideal for quick transport to the airport and the facilities are impressive. Nice pool, decent gym, great buffet restaurant with a good mixture of Asian and Western food. For business or a stop over I would choose this hotel everytime.
reviews.title: I like Novotel in Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only in Hong Kong for a 17 hour layover, so we chose to stay by the airport, since we arrived at 7:30pm and were leaving at 12:30pm the next day (otherwise, we would have gone into Kowloon). In general, we found this hotel to be pretty good. The hotel is very clean and modern inside. The only thing was that we specifically requested a non-smoking room at the time of booking, but when we arrived to check-in, they told us they only had smoking rooms left. We weren't happy about that. The hallways reeked of cigarette smoke, and our room smelt funny too.
reviews.title: Nice, modern hotel by the airport

reviews.text: The staff for the most part were nice, but in my opinion, they came off incompetent. We'd ask them answers, but they'd have no answer for us. The door people who carried our luggage were alright. The staff at the restaurant were extremely nice and accommodating, but the food is not that great, so if you have time, I'd suggest elsewhere.
reviews.title: nice hotel near the airport

reviews.text: The free shuttle bus from the airport was convenient. It literally takes 5 minutes, but the driver wasn't that nice. We came off snobby, but I found that most HK locals came off that way to foreigners.
reviews.title: Okay for the airport

reviews.text: The outlet mall that was attached, in my opinion, is boring, but that might just be because we arrived at such an odd time. Most of the stores were closed, and there didn't seem to be a good selection.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: I had a 15 hour stopover at this hotel on my my from Australia to Europe. The rooms were modern and clean and whilst a little on the small side were very adequate. The transfer service to and from the airport was quick and convenient and worked well for me. I used the cafe/restaruant during the afternoon and the food was tasty and premises sparkling clean. My only regret was that the female staff member (cashier) in the cafe was not personable and I wondered what she was doing working in customer service!!! The wait staff were very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: A good stopover hotel - met my expectations......

reviews.text: No complaints about the hotel at all. There was a free shuttle service to and from the airport, which we loved. We arrived early at around 9:00am but the front desk personnel very graciously allowed us to check into our rooms even before the check-in time. The rooms were beautiful, very modern, tastefully done, and spacious. We had our 4-year old daughter with us, and she was given an extra rollaway bed, free of charge. That left the queen-size bed to me and my husband, so all of us slept very well and comfortably. All the basic amenities you'd expect in a hotel are there; slippers, coffee and tea, toiletries, mini-ref... The only thing that puzzled me was that there was no divider between the rooms and the bathroom. The bed is just basically right next to the sink, mirrors, toilet, and showers (although the toilet and showers mercifully are enclosed). So, if you'd be doing your thing in the toilet, everyone in the bedroom would be sure to get a whiff once you open the door and step out. The service was superb. Even the housekeeping staff were very helpful in answering our questions. We didn't avail of the hotel breakfast, but since the hotel is directly connected to Citygate Mall (just an escalator ride and you're already in the mall), we didn't run out of choices of where to eat. Speaking of the mall, it is just as big and complete as those in Causeway or Central, with lots of popular retailers, and the shops are outlets too so we were able to buy a lot of things on sale. The mall also has a supermarket, money exchange center, and big fast food area, as well as a very convenient MTR exit (Tung Chung station). The MTR station is just next to Disneyland's Sunny Bay station, so if your main purpose for visiting HK is to go to Disneyland and/or shop at the outlet stores, this hotel would be absolutely perfect. But if you also intend on going around the city to Kowloon or Hongkong side, it might not be that ideal since the MTR ride can take up to an hour just going there.
reviews.title: clean, new, modern hotel right next to shopping mall

reviews.text: Really liked this hotel for a stopover. Very very comfortable, very very quiet. Facilities are excellent. I got a free transfer to and from the airport which was very convenient. The hotel is directly connected to an outlet mall. (Don't worry--the hotel is very quiet and doesn't seem too busy or chaotic.) The mall has high-quality stores (Burberry, Ralph Lauren, Coach, Nike, etc.) and in the basement there is a large grocery store with a *huge* selection of Asian and Western food.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for a stopover, perfect location next to MTR and outlet mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can access the MTR directly from the mall as well. Didn't think service was great--a bit brusque, but this is a stopover hotel so I didn't really care.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay, Great Food

reviews.text: We stayed at the Novotel Citygate in a stopover on long haul flights. The shuttle was quick and easy. We arrived very late and was starving. The rooms are very modern and clean - and the food and room service, typical of Hong Kong was really excellent. The shuttle to the airport the next day was again quick and easy. If there are faults with this hotel as a stopover, I certainly didn't see any!
reviews.title: Good break from the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on way to Hong Kong airport. Convenient shuttle bus that takes 10mins to airport. Excellent rooms.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel

reviews.text: The shuttle service works. The hotel is just OK. Not great for the price.
reviews.title: Perfect stopover hotel

reviews.text: Staying at the Novotel was my treat after a very long trip & I was not disappointed! Excellent staff, fantastic food, great views, immaculate rooms: all connected to a fantastic discount outlet shopping centre. Only 10 mins from Disneyland, shuttle bus drops you right at the doors of the airport when you have to leave (boo hoo!) I simply can't wait to go back to Hong Kong & stay there again, it was without doubt the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Every other hotel can learn something about hospitality from the staff at this Novotel!
reviews.title: Great location on a stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Citygate as a stopover before flying on home to New Zealand. What an absolutely fantastic hotel. Staff were friendly and very helpful. We were upgraded with our room and the buffet breakfast was divine. Has a great shiopping centre nearby and there is a free shuttle service to and from the airport. The room was great, clean, spacious and very inviting. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a stopover or a leisurely stay in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as it was very close to the airport and was running an advance-purchase promotion for a queen-size room on the executive floor including breakfast. It was excellent value for that, but even more so as we were upgraded to a suite on arrival.
reviews.title: Excellent stopover hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviewers have noted, it is close to the airport with a regular shuttle bus (every 15mins) to and from the terminal. When you exit customs you need to wait until the next 1/4 hour and then be escorted down to the bus parking (which takes another 5-10 mins) ... so if you just miss a bus and are tired it might be worth taking a taxi instead.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening after a flight from Australia and had a flight out to London the next afternoon. Our room was very spacious, in excellent condition and almost luxurious - double sinks, TV in the bath, sofa, desk, large screen TV in front of the bed. Everything you could want, including free wireless access. The breakfast was included in our very reasonable rate (booked a month or so in advance from the hotel's website) and was excellent quality and choice. I didn't take a swim but my wife reported that it has a lovely pool.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had planned to take the charilift from Tung Chung up to the 'Big Buddha' but ran out of time for that in the end. We did take advantage of the large shopping complex downstairs though as we had forgotten to pack a couple of things in our hand luggage, so it is very convenient for that also.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Friendly Staff

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.title: Great, cant be beaten for an airport overnight stay
reviews.text: On the first night I arrived at 1am, and was up and out of the hotel by 7am that morning, so just remember room being well appointed and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the way back through, was upgraded to the Junior Suite as my room was not available when I checked in, no complaint from me.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wished w e had stayed longer. From the pick up at the airport to the drop off we could not fault the service. We upgraded to a room on the 20th floor over looking the sea. It was peaceful, felt luxurious. The pool area is a wonderful place to relax, swim and enjoy the peaceful music. We would stay again this time for three days.
reviews.title: STOP OVER HAVEN

reviews.text: This hotel is only a 5-minute free shuttle ride from the airport. Nice modern rooms with a sit-down shower(no tub), robes. Did not eat at the hotel. Depending on the availability, the advance purchase-no refund rate can be very good. The shuttle takes you back to the airport - runs every 15 minutes.
reviews.title: very good for airport stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Novotel Citygate
reviews.title: A Top Stop

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights here on way to UK/Europe, arriving late Friday and left early Sunday. I chose it because of proximity to the airport, and the Ngong Ping cable car and Tai O village.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel.

reviews.text: The shuttle from the airport arrived promptly, we had booked non smoking and so it was. Reception was rather impersonal-we weren't offered any help with baggage. Our bags were wheelies so it didn't matter,but it seemed cold .The room was a slightly odd layout with the fridge/coffee making ensconced in a central pillar and no wall to the bathroom. Plenty of tea & coffee & bottled water-that made me wonder if the water was safe to drink, so I rang the desk to ask. The message became confused-and housekeeping arrived with more bottled water!
reviews.title: Oasis after a long flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived quite early so booked 2 nights to guarantee "early" checkin and prepaid. So very surprised on arrival to find we needed to wiat while reception sent someone to "check" the room? However, once we were checked in the room was very pleasant and an ideal spot for an extended intransit stopover. Shuttle service was good and frequent. Shopping centre in the surrounds provided access to most people's needs.
reviews.title: Pleasant, comfortable & well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is very pleasant.
reviews.title: Top Class hotel

reviews.text: The train station, within the complex, took some finding, despite being able to see the line. If you want to go to HongKong central, it is a very efficient means to access the city, with frequent, new, clean trains and not expensive.
reviews.title: best place to stay in Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night each way on a trip from NZ to Europe. It proved to be the perfect start and finish to our holiday. When you get off a 12 hour flight you are a bit numb! You just want to 'crash". This place was perfect. The pool is fantastic so we had a swim before hitting the sack. There are blackout curtains on the windows and the place is silent. It was perfect. On one direction we took the local bus, a 5 minute walk away, to see the giant Budda. A great trip, and I expect that if you had a head for heights the cable car could be quite exciting! There was excellent shopping in the attached mall. We thought that we might be missing out on the HK experience being this far from town. However on the return trip we got what must be one of the easiest MRT trains (another 5 minute walk) for the 45 minute ride into town. This just confirmed we had made the right choice. We found HK to be "full on". We were pleased to be away from the downtown turmoil.
reviews.title: Good value hotel in an excellent position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were particuarly helpful. Some of the reviews had made us nervouse about the bath room, but it's fine. The glass to the bathroom is frosted. We booked directly on the Accorr website ($550Hk) and then paid for an optional upgrade that included breakfast. 5* luxury at a 3* price
reviews.title: A really great hotel

description: The only airport hotel in Hong Kong with city convenience, Novotel Hong Kong Citygate is just 5 minutes from Hong Kong International Airport and AsiaWorld-Expo. With direct access to MTR, it takes only 30 minutes to the city centre and Hong Kong Disneyland is 2 stops away. Enjoy spectacular views from the Ngong Ping Cable Car and discover bargain shopping at Citygate Outlets, both are at the doorstep. Features meeting facilities, two restaurants, a bar, a 24-hour gym and swimming pool.
